37  node::node(std::string _name) : name(_name), parent(NULL) {

40  node::node(node* parentnode) {
41  parent = parentnode;
42  parent->childs.push_back(this);
43  }

45  node::~node() {
46  done();

49  void node::dump(size_t indent) {
50  intent(indent);
51  std::cout << name << ":" << value << std::endl;
52 
53  std::map<std::string, std::string>::iterator iter = attributes.begin();
54  while (iter != attributes.end()) {
55  intent(indent);
56  std::cout << (*iter).first << "=\"" << (*iter).second << "\"" << std::endl;
57  iter++;
58  }
59 
60  for (size_t i = 0; i < childs.size(); ++i) {
61  childs[i]->dump(indent + 1);
62  }
63  }
64 
65  void node::intent(size_t pos) {
66  for (size_t i = 0; i < pos; ++i) std::cout << " ";
67  };
68 
69  void node::done() {
70  for (size_t i = 0; i < childs.size(); ++i) {
71  delete childs[i];
72  }
73 
74  childs.clear();
75  }
76 
77  node* node::foundChild(std::string tagName, size_t pos) {
78  size_t found = 0;
79  for (size_t i = 0; i < childs.size(); ++i) {
80  if (childs[i]->name == tagName) {
81  if (found++ == pos) return childs[i];
82  }
83  }
84 
85  return NULL;
86  }

88  xml_scanner::xml_scanner(void) {

90  }

92  xml_scanner::~xml_scanner(void) {

98  void xml_scanner::close() {
99  rootnode.done();
100 
101  }

103  char xml_scanner::read_next_char(void) {
104  char buffer = 0;
105  if (stream.is_open() && !stream.eof()) {
106  stream.read(&buffer, 1);
107  } else context = endfile;
108 
109  return buffer;
110  }
111 
112  char xml_scanner::read_next_non_space_char(void) {
113  char x;
114  while ((x = read_next_char()) != 0 && (x == ' '));
115 
116  return x;
117  }
118 
119  string xml_scanner::read_word() {
120  string word;
121  char x;
122 
123  //skip initial spaces
124  while ((x = read_next_char()) != 0 && (x == ' ' || x == '\n' || x == '\r')) {
125  }
126  stream.unget();
127 
128  while ((x = read_next_char()) != 0 && (x != ' ' && x != '>' && x != '?' && x != '=' && x != '/')) {
129  if (x != '\n' && x != '\r') word += x;
130  }
131 
132  stream.unget();
133  return word;
134  }
135 
136  string xml_scanner::read_literal(void) {
137  string word;
138  char x;
139 
140  //skip initial spaces
141  //while ( (x = read_next_char()) && x != '"') {}
142 
143  while ((x = read_next_char()) != 0 && x != '"') word += x;
144 
145  return word;
146  }
147 
148  node* xml_scanner::scan_file(string filePath) {
149  currnode = &rootnode;
150  context = value;
151 
152  stream.open(filePath.c_str(), ios_base::in | std::ios_base::binary);
153 
154  if (!stream) {
155  // Unable to open the file, so check error type
156  // Get the state of the I/O State Flags
157  unsigned int i = stream.rdstate();
158 
159  if (i & ios::eofbit)throw eternity::exception("EOF Encountered");
160  else if (i & ios::failbit) throw eternity::exception("Non-fatal I/O Error occurred");
161  else if (i & ios::badbit)
162  // Set when 'catastrophic' errors occur in I/O operations
163  // For example, when file does not exist. Note, however, that
164  // this behaviour may not be totally platform independant.
165  // That is, on my system (Borland 5.0 under Windows NT 4.0)
166  // masking ios::badbit with the state flag gives true when the file
167  // cannot be found; whether this
168  // is definitely true on other systems, I cannot say
169  throw eternity::exception("Fatal I/O Error occurred");
170 
171  // NOTE: Instead of using 'rdstate' etc..., you could use the
172  // following member functions
173  // * fin.eof() ==> true if (state & ios::eofbit) true
174  // * fin.fail() ==> true if (state & ios::failbit) true
175  // * fin.bad() ==> true if (state & ios::badbit) true
176 
177  }
178 
179  while (context != endfile) {
180  switch (context) {
181  case (value): read_value();
182  break;
183  case (tagname): read_tag_name();
184  break;
185  case (closebracket): close_bracket();
186  break;
187  case (closetag): read_close_tag();
188  break;
189  case (attr): read_attributes();
190  break;
191  case (attrvalue): read_attribute_value();
192  break;
193  case (comment): read_comment();
194  break;
195  case (doctype): read_doc_type();
196  break;
197  default:
198  break;
199  }
200  }
201 
202  //debug only
203  //rootnode.dump(0);
204 
205  stream.clear();
206 
207  if (stream.is_open()) {
208  stream.close();
209  }
210 
211  return &rootnode;
212  }
213 
214  void xml_scanner::read_value(void) {
215  while (true) {
216  char x = read_next_char();
217 
218  // reach the end of file?
219  if (context == endfile) return;
220 
221  // opening tag?
222  if (x == '<') {
223  x = read_next_non_space_char();
224 
225  // reach the end of file?
226  if (context == endfile) return;
227 
228  //here looking for comment : if x=="--" ecc.)
229  if (x == '/') {
230  //stream.unget();
231  context = closetag;
232  return;
233  }
234  if (x == '?') {
235  // here will mangage <? ... ?>
236  node* _node = new node(currnode);
237  currnode = _node;
238  context = tagname;
239  return;
240  }
241  if (x == '!') {
242  x = read_next_non_space_char();
243  // reach the end of file?
244  if (context == endfile) return;
245 
246  if (x == '-') {
247  context = comment;
248  return;
249  } else {
250  context = doctype;
251  return;
252  }
253  } else {
254  stream.unget();
255  node* _node = new node(currnode);
256  currnode = _node;
257  context = tagname;
258  return;
259  }
260 
261  } else currnode->value += x;
262 
263 
264  }
265  }
266 
267  void xml_scanner::read_tag_name(void) {
268  currnode->name = read_word();
269 
270  // reach the end of file?
271  if (context == endfile) return;
272 
273  if (currnode->name.empty()) throw new eternity::exception("tag without name");
274 
275  context = attr;
276 
277  }
278 
279  void xml_scanner::read_attributes(void) {
280  currAttribute = read_word();
281 
282  // reach the end of file?
283  if (context == endfile) return;
284 
285  // closing tag?
286  if (currAttribute.empty()) {
287  context = closebracket;
288  return;
289  } else context = attrvalue;
290  }
291 
292  void xml_scanner::close_bracket(void) {
293  char x = read_next_non_space_char();
294 
295  // reach the end of file?
296  if (context == endfile) return;
297 
298  // simply exit like <tag >
299  if (x == '>') {
300  context = value;
301  return;
302  }
303 
304  // closing tag with <tag ^/> ?
305  if (x != '/' && x != '?') throw new eternity::exception("irregular closing bracket");
306 
307  x = read_next_non_space_char();
308 
309  // reach the end of file?
310  if (context == endfile) return;
311 
312  if (x != '>') throw new eternity::exception("irregular closing bracket");
313  context = value;
314  currnode = currnode->parent;
315 
316  }
317 
318  void xml_scanner::read_attribute_value(void) {
319  char x = read_next_non_space_char();
320 
321  // reach the end of file?
322  if (context == endfile) return;
323 
324  // closing tag?
325  if (x != '=') {
326  stream.unget();
327  currnode->attributes[currAttribute] = "";
328  context = attr;
329  return;
330  }
331 
332  x = read_next_non_space_char();
333 
334  // reach the end of file?
335  if (context == endfile) return;
336 
337  string value;
338 
339  if (x == '"') value = read_literal();
340  else {
341  stream.unget();
342  value = read_word();
343  };
344 
345  currnode->attributes[currAttribute] = value;
346 
347  context = attr;
348 
349  }
350 
351  void xml_scanner::read_close_tag(void) {
352  string tag = read_word();
353 
354  // reach the end of file?
355  if (context == endfile) return;
356 
357  if (tag != currnode->name) throw new eternity::exception("closing tag " + tag + " doesn't match");
358 
359  char x = read_next_non_space_char();
360 
361  // reach the end of file?
362  if (context == endfile) return;
363 
364 
365  // closing tag?
366  if (x != '>') throw new eternity::exception("irregular closing of tag " + tag + " doesn't match");
367 
368  context = value;
369  currnode = currnode->parent;
370 
371  }
372 
373  void xml_scanner::read_comment(void) {
374  size_t step = 0;
375  while (true) {
376  char x = read_next_char();
377 
378  // reach the end of file?
379  if (context == endfile) return;
380 
381  if (step == 0 && x == '-') ++step;
382  else if (step == 1) {
383  if (x == '-') ++step;
384  else step = 0;
385  } else if (step == 2) {
386  if (x == '>') {
387  context = value;
388  return;
389  } else step = 0;
390  }
391 
392  }
393  }
394 
395  void xml_scanner::read_doc_type(void) {
396  while (true) {
397  char x = read_next_char();
398 
399  // reach the end of file?
400  if (context == endfile) return;
401 
402  if (x == '>') {
403  context = value;
404  return;
405  }
406 
407 
408  }
409  }
410 
411 };
412
